Name: Confidence & Knowledge Calibrator
Purpose: Model the relationship between objective investing knowledge, perceived understanding, and decision confidence to identify under- and over-confidence zones in the target users
Deliverables: Calibration curves and utility functions mapping (a) factual knowledge levels, (b) self-assessed confidence, and (c) decision quality proxies (e.g., diversification, time horizon alignment); identifies ranges where guidance should be more prescriptive, more exploratory, or more educational
Strengths: Good at distinguishing users who need guardrails from those ready for autonomy, and at defining knowledge increments and feedback mechanisms that raise confidence without encouraging reckless behavior
Watch-out: Fails when proxies for decision quality are poorly chosen or when self-reported confidence is systematically biased; can misguide product decisions if it assumes static preferences rather than learning and adaptation over time
